exclusion_reasons: Stable Hands Equine Therapy - Adult mental health/substance abuse/veterans only, not autism-specific
W.A.R. Warriors At Rest, Inc. - Veterans/combat PTSD only, not autism-specific

providers.name: Juliana Ochoa, LMHC
providers.description: Equine-assisted therapy for adolescents, young adults, and adults

providers.name: Changing leads @ Kiddy Up Ranch
providers.description: Non profit therapy ranch for children, adults and veterans

providers.name: HERD Foundation 501c3
providers.description: Equine-assisted activities for personal development. Serves Military Veterans, Youth in Foster Care, Adults with Disabilities, youth at risk, grief and loss programs

providers.name: Berger Counseling Services
credentials: PATH Int'l Certified Therapeutic Riding Instructor
providers.description: Experiential Therapies - Art Therapy, Sandtray Therapy, & Play Therapy. Specializes in grief & loss, depression, anxiety, trauma, abuse, adoption issues and substance abuse

providers.name: Berger Counseling Services
providers.description: Equine Assisted Psychotherapy alongside play and sand tray therapies with children and adolescents in Parkland, Florida. Accepts Private Pay Only

providers.name: Tomorrow's Rainbow
providers.description: Nurtures emotional wellness and resiliency for children, teens, and families experiencing grief, loss, or trauma. Free peer support groups for children ages 3 to 18 who have experienced the death of somebody significant in their life. Individual Eagala therapy services for mental health challenges including trauma, anxiety and depression

providers.name: Healing Hoof Steps
providers.description: Two distinct programs: Clinical equine assisted mental health counseling using licensed counselors, non-riding activities, an immersive outdoor setting and a working herd of horses; and the holistic PATH Riding Program which consists of Certified Instructors offering a mix of educational activities on horseback for those with physical, emotional and/or developmental disabilities

providers.name: Kindred Spirits Therapy Minis
providers.description: 501(c)(3) non-profit dedicated to improving the health and wellbeing of children and adults who are living with physical or emotional impairment. Goal is to provide an opportunity for emotional, social, and behavioral growth and learning, as well as other forms of rehabilitation, through work with horses. Target audience includes members in the emergency services field, children and adults suffering the loss of a family member, individuals in the 'end of life transition', students in the nursing or health community and as always our military family
